intro: Amsinckia microsperma, commonly known as the dwarf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence. Amsinckia microsperma is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is considered a rare and endangered species.
